intro: Ptilostemon stellatus, commonly known as the star-leaved ptilostemon, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in shrubland and woodland habitats, preferring well-drained soils. It produces small, white or pink flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
